title: Welcome to the era of tanks.
body:
LCS is actually fun to watch again. ADCs have to actually think about positioning and not just mindlessly attack.
Diversity is back in the jungle, and other lanes as a result.
5.5 is the BEST patch in a  very long time.

replies.body:
League of assassins: gets deleted in 1 second, lol wat just happened.

League of mages: gets deleted in 1 second from 800 range, lol wat just happened.

League of adc: gets deleted in 1 second from 550 range, lol wat just happened.

League of bruisers: gets deleted in 2 seconds by someone 3 times as tanky, that was fair...

League of supports: dies to a support, what the fuck

League of tanks: fair gameplay, fun teamfights, proper balance and class identity. Fun jungler diversity, and interesting team comps.
bias post is biased.
+1 to sin counter

League of tanks: Get killed by someone who builds no damage and takes no damage

League of everyone has a place in a team comp and no class invalidates another: What we all wish LoL was
League of Fantasies.
there was league of tanks before and people complained and it got nerfed, trust me people will complain again soon
Just wait till they "Olaf" Sejuani and Volibear...
Fitting considering all three of them are allies in the lore

Literally nothing has been done to lane tanks since when people were shouting "Tanking is dead". Now, here we are saying they're viable because their innately less efficient jungle brethren got buffed.

> [{quoted}](name=TotalJerk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HjaaJ3hO,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-22T01:10:10.629+0000)
>
> Literally nothing has been done to lane tanks since when people were shouting "Tanking is dead". Now, here we are saying they're viable because their innately less efficient jungle brethren got buffed.

It is way more easy to punish a lane tank than a jungle tank.  The problem with tanks has always been they always meant you lost the game before you could become effective. Now that tank junglers can actually survive the early game. They can exist again.

Some clarity if you please, but is {{champion:39}}  a tank or not a tank?

because her damage is often good and her LS on hit due to her W? and Ult often make her deceptively tank, but i often see people either add her or forget about her in the list of tanks.

maybe she's more feed or famine than i assume or her non tanky build is more prevalent then i thought?
Oh, Irelia is a melee bruiser, not a tank. I don't really know why they downvoted u
Irelia is a melee assassin bruiser mage support tanky dps carry. Or is that Lee Sin? ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
No, Lee Sin is that Ranged, Melee, Tanky DPS, Assassin, Mage, Tank, Support and Jungler. I can see how you got confused though.

Haha, a fellow Rioter and good friend mains {{champion:28}} and is Diamond. The night is scary.
Wait he is the player Diamond? Or Is A Diamond player?
Yes
Well my brother, enjoy the disgustingness of {{champion:6}} while you can.

Someone will complain about tanks.  Threads about how happy people were tanks were dead and assassins, mages, and carries were playable in the jungle/top/mid popped up.

Doesn't matter what's being played, someone will be upset.

There's not more diversity, characters like  Sejuani, Amumu and Zac are just coming back and taking the spot of now slightly weaker jungler.
Same shit, just different heroes.

> [{quoted}](name=1st HanarSpectre,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HjaaJ3hO,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-03-22T04:17:21.005+0000)
>
> There's not more diversity, characters like  Sejuani, Amumu and Zac are just coming back and taking the spot of now slightly weaker jungler.
> Same shit, just different heroes.

People on here don't actually know what "Champion diversity" is.

Has anyone ever thought that a meta where tanks are strong is a meta where adc's are strong? In a world where Sejuani and Nautilus are good how can the likes of Ahri or Zed kill the enemy Jinx or Kog? They can stay safe behind their now relevant allies and kill the powerful enemy tank no one else can. Seriously, tanks are like an adc's best friend not an adversary.

Tanks also make control mages strong because of the obvious synergy between the two

Raise your {{champion:61}}
It's like people are finally remembering how to play LoL or something.
Assassins are a dying breed, that's all I've gotta say.

I'm seeing a lot of adc mains go "omg they shouldn't deal damage without building it"

And I'm like

{{item:3153}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3022}} 

if it's really that much of an issue

> "omg they shouldn't deal damage without building it"

Then ADCs shouldn't tank without building it. So let's reduce their tank-stats to 100 HP and 10 armor. Let's remove lifesteal from offensive items, and let's remove all kind of CC/mobility/passive tankiness ADCs have.
the downvotes make me think that people missed the invisible #kappa in this post....
People has no sense of humor these days D:
I'm a jungle main and I **still** maintain that tanky mobile damage dealers are absolutely retarded >.>.

SInce cinderhulk, any abilities that scale off HP have made some champions ridiculous (Sej, Voli, etc), but people forget that adc's scale into late game. If a tank can reach an adc before late-game, of course the adc is going to die. They're tissue paper. That's why they have a support to protect them, that's why positioning is so important.

Late-game, adc's make tanks their bitch by outright ignoring 1/3 of their armor, doubling their attack damage with critical chance, several autoattacks every few seconds, and not to mention dealing 8% of their health if they have botrk and so on and so on.

*shrugs*

Late-game, if my calculations are correct, a tank can last upward to 10 seconds against a full-build adc. The exact number might be different, but it's worth some investigation.

But adc's are squishy. Because of the late-game scaling, they can't take it until their full build gives sustain, and they can't dish it out about mid-game. So of course any amount of damage from at tank is going to kill them. Armor and magic resist start falling off late-game, and between LW and all the other items, adc's will start domination.

And before people say I'm biased, I play adc plenty (I find it kinda boring, but that's because I don't like taking risks and focus on cs), I play a few tanks (the really strong ones, sorry... trying to find weaker ones to play so I'm not some meta broker), I play squishies and bruisers and blah blah blah. And besides, I hope no one tries to get angry at me or say I'm "bad" or something, I'm just giving my opinion on a forum (so many people...).

To quote Left 4 Dead...

*ahem*


**TAAAAAAAAAAAANKKKKKK!**

One day, people will rage about the rise of the tanks again. Remember the beginning of S4 when Mundo, Renekton, Shyvana, and Trundle ruled the game?

Some older champs may have risen up, but all they did was crowd out some of the older ones, then when they cycle of nerfs returns, it's back to no more tanks

This is how it feels to use a tank right now:
http://cdn.themetapicture.com/pic/images/2015/03/20/funny-gif-kitten-fighting-big-cat-hit.gif

Maokai, 4000 HP, 400 Armor, 20% damage reduction from ult, 10% damage reduction against critical strikes
I'm Yi

Maokai: yi come 1v1 me at baron see how fast you can kill me
Me: ok
*kills maokai in literally four seconds*
Agree completely. It's great having tanks back in the meta. The game is much more balanced because of it.
